title: The good fortune of the French baguette is rising again
summary: At a time when the French are eating less and less bread, artisan bakers continue to innovate, expanding their presence in the fast food market, where mass-produced chains rule. It's a distinctively French phenomenon.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Egypt tries to pressure Israel out of an offensive on Rafah
summary: According to Cairo, challenging the peace agreement between Egypt and Israel is out of the question.

title: Paris Olympics 2024: Macron rules booksellers should be 'preserved'
summary: In the absence of a 'consensual solution,' Emmanuel Macron decided to abandon the relocation of Paris booksellers' stalls, which the Paris police prefect and city hall had planned for critical security reasons.

title: Estonia has long been ready for war against Russia
summary: This small Baltic country of 1.3 million inhabitants, which regained its independence in 1991, has never stopped regarding Moscow as an 'existential threat.'

title: Biden slams Trump's 'dumb' and 'dangerous' NATO threats
summary: Trump claimed he would encourage Russia to attack NATO members who failed to meet financial commitments.

title: Not your grandma's mink coat: Fur sheds its baggage in the hopes of a makeover
summary: Buoyed by the 'mob wife' trend for ostentatious luxury, real fur is making a quiet comeback. Craftsmen are working to bring out the best in old mink and sable pieces or to work with skins from the food industry.

title: Yasmine Belkaid, an immunity explorer, becomes head of the Institut Pasteur
summary: The French-Algerian immunologist took up her post as president of France's flagship biomedical research institution in January.

title: Indonesia: intellectuals denounce 'interference' by outgoing president ahead of elections
summary: Current Head of State Joko Widodo is backing one of the candidates running to succeed him, current Defense Minister Prabowo Subianto, putting him at odds with the expected duty of neutrality.

title: After Godrèche's sexual abuse accusations, release of new films by Doillon and Jacquot disrupted
summary: Distribution of the directors' forthcoming feature films is in jeopardy after the actress lodged rape complaints against them.

title: The French's feeling of injustice reveals Macron's failure to bring about a merit-based society
summary: In the face of defiance and a feeling of social contempt, the French president's plan, the core of which was to emancipate and open up society, is perceived as having hit a dead end, according to researchers Bruno Cautrès, Gilles Ivaldi, Luc Rouban and Virginie Tournay.

title: Senegal suspends mobile internet, bans protest march over vote delay
summary: The UN voiced concern about tensions in the country after President Macky Sall moved to postpone the February 25 presidential election.

title: Chinese robots conquer factories
summary: As China rapidly automates its factories, Beijing is supporting the emergence of local robot manufacturers to capitalize on this trend.

title: France sanctions 28 'extremist' Israeli settlers
summary: Violence perpetrated by settlers against the Palestinian population in the occupied West Bank has increased in recent months.

title: France says Russian disinformation attacks to 'intensify' ahead of EU election
summary: French Foreign Minister Stéphane Séjourné, in a video posted on X, said a French state agency had discovered a network of 193 Russian websites, spreading propaganda before the June 6-9 EU Parliament elections.

title: Handing out sunglasses in the Himalayas to protect against the damaging sun
summary: In Pakistan's Naltar Valley, the sun's rays are so intense that eight out of 10 people suffer from eye problems. German photographer Cornelius Kaess followed the work of Shades of Love, an NGO that gives sunglasses to these high-altitude inhabitants.

title: In the Netherlands, US and UK, military aid to Israel is challenged in the courts
summary: A Dutch court ordered the government on Monday to halt the export of F-35 parts to Israel, citing a clear risk of violations of international law.

title: The United States plays a crucial role in Europe's defense
summary: Former president Donald Trump's suggestion of an American withdrawal from NATO is worrying Europe, which does not have the resources, logistics or equipment to ensure its own security.

title: A Miss Japan of Ukrainian origin rekindles debate on Japanese identity
summary: The victory of the first woman of foreign origin in the contest has sparked controversy, followed by scandal, in Japan.
